creator: mhuffman@ca.ibm.com
text:
Unique Particle Attribution constraints in:

http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-1/#non-ambig

state that a <choice> group cannot have "overlapping" particles. An <any> and 
an <element> "overlap" if the <element>'s namespace or the namespace of any 
other <element>s in that <element>'s substitutionGroup matches the <any>'s 
namespace constraint. Here is a test which violates this constraint and the 
error is not reported by the parser.

3_8si16.xml
===========
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<si:root xmlns:xsi         ="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
         xmlns:si          ="http://www.Test.org/3_8si"
         xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.Test.org/3_8si
                             3_8si16.xsd">
<badElem>
  <si:elem3>10</si:elem3>
</badElem>
</si:root>

3_8si16.xsd
===========
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<schema xmlns          ="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"
        xmlns:siimp    ="http://www.Test.org/3_8si_imp"
        xmlns:si       ="http://www.Test.org/3_8si"
        targetNamespace="http://www.Test.org/3_8si">

<import namespace="http://www.Test.org/3_8si_imp"
        schemaLocation="3_8si16_imp.xsd"/>

<complexType name="badType">
  <choice>
    <any namespace="##targetNamespace" processContents="skip"/>
    <element ref="siimp:elem1"/>
  </choice>
</complexType>

<element name="elem3" type="integer" substitutionGroup="siimp:elem2"/>

<element name="root">
  <complexType>
    <sequence>
      <element name="badElem" type="si:badType" minOccurs="0"/>
    </sequence>
  </complexType>
</element>

</schema>

3_8si16_imp.xsd
===============
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<schema xmlns          ="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"
        xmlns:siimp    ="http://www.Test.org/3_8si_imp"
        targetNamespace="http://www.Test.org/3_8si_imp">

<element name="elem1" type="integer"/>
<element name="elem2" type="integer" substitutionGroup="siimp:elem1"/>

</schema>

creator: sandygao@ca.ibm.com
text: now we consider substitution group for UPA checking
